TopicTitle: [1.1.2] KSPRC - Renaissance Compilation: artworks remake [V-0.7 Pre Release 3]

Articles.Content: The EnvMap PositiveY.png texture is flipped along the wrong axis. It should be flipped vertically in relation to the skybox, but it is flipped horizontally.

Hi SmashBrown.

I'm having the same issue you describe. Can you please provide a little more detail on what you did to fix it (manually moving the files over?)

Thanks!

Hey, i simply went into each folder within texture replacer, and moved proot's files across into them, i did not move anything from the plugin folder though, and obviously did not overwrite the .version file. After that it worked. Make sure you have the latest version of TR as well.

So what is the status ? I was hoping that new KSPRC to be released around august and still nothing

Modders are volunteers working in their free time and are under no obligation to release anything, ever, let alone to some schedule. Enjoy the current KSPRC and the update will come when it comes.

Modders are volunteers working in their free time and are under no obligation to release anything, ever, let alone to some schedule. Enjoy the current KSPRC and the update will come when it comes.

Proot is a very serious guy and KSPRC is something he really trust in. I know he is very busy in RL but not for this reason he leave the project. Probably is just slowing down the update to wait the new Unity5 and its change.

Just be patient

Alive (and around) please, excuse my absence.

Usually August is a hard month in Spain but this year has been particularly strange.

I have a lot of work in this epoch but at the same time the summer is the top in the spanish "way of life" (touristic country...).

And, sadly, my old computer definitely died under the high temperatures of this year.

So I have to work a plus to get a new one...

I think I could retake the project again in September with a new computer. Meanwhile, please be patient.

Cheers!

Edited August 30, 2015 by Proot
Good to hear that your still around! Hope everything works out for you!

If this had happened during winter it would have been more problematic. Fortunately the summer is economically much better over here and is easier to make a little extra. The bad side is that I use too my PC to work in my arts and designs... so I must buy a workstation for edition, wich is usually more expensive than a regular gaming computer...
